subject: some minor little things on the quote platform we have noticed
preview: @joel FYI, Dan's response: Hi Heath That all sounds good. In terms of the additional items, please start but you can ignore number 8 for the moment. We can make so with the platform as it is this

full_threads.body:
@joel FYI, Dan's response: 


Hi Heath 

That all sounds good. 

In terms of the additional items, please start but you can ignore number 8 for the moment. We can make so with the platform as it is this year because there are only a few weeks left of offering free extension until sold. We can tackle this next year.

In terms of the google API, I’m hearing you. I’m surprised that there hasn’t been pressure on them to get this right - we can’t be the only business relying on this field? The weird thing is that it finds the right unit and unit number but when you select it, it forgets the unit number (hence I assumed it could have something to do with the coding as the api seems to work). Not an issue mate, we will continue with the workaround. 

Dan

@joel FYI, I have just sent this to Dan, please commence with item 5 and 6 and I'll let you know once we have approval for the others. 

Cheers, 


Hi Dan, 
Sorry we didn’t get a chance to chat yesterday. 

We have reviewed the below and I have consolidated into 3 areas: Fixes, Explanations and Additions. 

———————— 

FIXES
- we will look into these at no additional charge

(5) The stylists are sometimes missing in the word document the fact that the optional extras HAS NOT been selected. We need it to stay on the paperwork, but can we perhaps put a horizontal strike through on it?

(6) It is doing this weird thing with Tamara’s IPAD where if she stays on Tab 4 for a long time then it freezes her out or when she puts on an extra pre-filled room, it pushes them up into the room above! See attached screenshot showing an example. Is it perhaps a fix to autosave after say 5 minutes?

———————— 

EXPLANTION 

(3) The auto populate address field doesn’t work too well when it comes to units. For example, if you type in 4/27 York St, Sydney, the it autopopulates 27 York St Sydney but leaves out the unit number? Is there any chance we can fix this?
Answer: we have previously discussed this… it’s basically down to the Google API that we are using to lookup addresses. Please note, this is a different dataset to the one that’s available in the publicly listed Google Maps. So essentially we are at their mercy on this one.

———————— 

ADDITIONS - these are going to take an estimate 8hrs to build 

(1) On Tab 2 Agent Details, we have never had a field with “Agent Phone Number”. Is it possible to add one please? It can go to the right of the “Agent Email” box.

(2) How difficult would it be for us to have an agent database that sits in the background that we populate. That way, each time someone starts typing in an agent name, they can select the name from a pre-defined list and upon selection, there is an automatic population of agency, email address and phone number. This would save our operators lots of time filling this out. Not so much of an issue on a PC because Google Chrome seems to remember fields, but on the IpAD these fields are constantly being done from scratch.

(4) This is probably not an easy one – sometimes we need to move a room up from optional extras into the main quote or visa versa. We hoped to just be able to drag it down under optional extras line (or visa versa) but alas it doesn’t work ☹. Any quick way we can re-assign an optional extra room into the main quote without having to redo the entire room?

(7) Creating a template. This is a great function but after a while, the template gets pushed down and down into the platform so you have to go onto that second or third page to find them. Any way we can keep the templated homes more easily accessible?

(8) Style Until it Sells. We are offering an end of year special which is basically if you style for 4 weeks, you get unlimited free weeks after that until the home sells. We only offer this on vacant properties that are marketed in December etc so the eligibility of it is limited. Currently it’s difficult to express this in the quote though. So I was thinking we could have an additional field in the ‘FREE WEEKS’ dropdown that said “Free Till Sold” or something similar and then if it was selected, the free weeks would read : Proposal includes 4 weeks, delivery, styling and collection. Subsequent week to week rental is FREE until the property is sold (subject to Ts and Cs).” The part in red would substitute the current script which simply says how many free weeks you get based on the selection.

———————— 

We will commence on items 5 and 6 this week. Please let us know if we are clear to start the Additions items too. 

Thanks and speak soon,

--- THINGS THAT NEEDS TO BE CODED ---
(1) On Tab 2 Agent Details, we have never had a field with “Agent Phone Number”. Is it possible to add one please? It can go to the right of the “Agent Email” box.

(2) How difficult would it be for us to have an agent database that sits in the background that we populate. That way, each time someone starts typing in an agent name, they can select the name from a pre-defined list and upon selection, there is an automatic population of agency, email address and phone number. This would save our operators lots of time filling this out. Not so much of an issue on a PC because Google Chrome seems to remember fields, but on the IpAD these fields are constantly being done from scratch.

(4) This is probably not an easy one – sometimes we need to move a room up from optional extras into the main quote or visa versa. We hoped to just be able to drag it down under optional extras line (or visa versa) but alas it doesn’t work ☹. Any quick way we can re-assign an optional extra room into the main quote without having to redo the entire room?

(7) Creating a template. This is a great function but after a while, the template gets pushed down and down into the platform so you have to go onto that second or third page to find them. Any way we can keep the templated homes more easily accessible?

(8) Style Until it Sells. We are offering an end of year special which is basically if you style for 4 weeks, you get unlimited free weeks after that until the home sells. We only offer this on vacant properties that are marketed in December etc so the eligibility of it is limited. Currently it’s difficult to express this in the quote though. So I was thinking we could have an additional field in the ‘FREE WEEKS’ dropdown that said “Free Till Sold” or something similar and then if it was selected, the free weeks would read : Proposal includes 4 weeks, delivery, styling and collection. Subsequent week to week rental is FREE until the property is sold (subject to Ts and Cs).” The part in red would substitute the current script which simply says how many free weeks you get based on the selection.

--- THINGS TO CHECK ---
(5) The stylists are sometimes missing in the word document the fact that the optional extras HAS NOT been selected. We need it to stay on the paperwork, but can we perhaps put a horizontal strike through on it?

(6) It is doing this weird thing with Tamara’s IPAD where if she stays on Tab 4 for a long time then it freezes her out or when she puts on an extra pre-filled room, it pushes them up into the room above! See attached screenshot showing an example. Is it perhaps a fix to autosave after say 5 minutes?

--- I THINK WE NEED TO EXPLAIN THIS (its a google map thingy) ---
(3) The auto populate address field doesn’t work too well when it comes to units. For example, if you type in 4/27 York St, Sydney, the it autopopulates 27 York St Sydney but leaves out the unit number? Is there any chance we can fix this?

@heath

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath

As discussed earlier, it would be good to find 10 minutes on Monday to walk you through some of these bugs and tweaks we would like to address with the quote platform. In advance of that, I’ve had a go at summarising below.

On Tab 2 Agent Details, we have never had a field with “Agent Phone Number”. Is it possible to add one please? It can go to the right of the “Agent Email” box.
How difficult would it be for us to have an agent database that sits in the background that we populate. That way, each time someone starts typing in an agent name, they can select the name from a pre-defined list and upon selection, there is an automatic population of agency, email address and phone number. This would save our operators lots of time filling this out. Not so much of an issue on a PC because Google Chrome seems to remember fields, but on the IpAD these fields are constantly being done from scratch.
The auto populate address field doesn’t work too well when it comes to units. For example, if you type in 4/27 York St, Sydney, the it autopopulates 27 York St Sydney but leaves out the unit number? Is there any chance we can fix this?
This is probably not an easy one – sometimes we need to move a room up from optional extras into the main quote or visa versa. We hoped to just be able to drag it down under optional extras line (or visa versa) but alas it doesn’t work ☹. Any quick way we can re-assign an optional extra room into the main quote without having to redo the entire room?
The stylists are sometimes missing in the word document the fact that the optional extras HAS NOT been selected. We need it to stay on the paperwork, but can we perhaps put a horizontal strike through on it?
It is doing this weird thing with Tamara’s IPAD where if she stays on Tab 4 for a long time then it freezes her out or when she puts on an extra pre-filled room, it pushes them up into the room above! See attached screenshot showing an example. Is it perhaps a fix to autosave after say 5 minutes?
Creating a template. This is a great function but after a while, the template gets pushed down and down into the platform so you have to go onto that second or third page to find them. Any way we can keep the templated homes more easily accessible?
Style Until it Sells. We are offering an end of year special which is basically if you style for 4 weeks, you get unlimited free weeks after that until the home sells. We only offer this on vacant properties that are marketed in December etc so the eligibility of it is limited. Currently it’s difficult to express this in the quote though. So I was thinking we could have an additional field in the ‘FREE WEEKS’ dropdown that said “Free Till Sold” or something similar and then if it was selected, the free weeks would read : Proposal includes 4 weeks, delivery, styling and collection. Subsequent week to week rental is FREE until the property is sold (subject to Ts and Cs).” The part in red would substitute the current script which simply says how many free weeks you get based on the selection.

Look forward to discussing next week.

Have a great weekend!

Dan


Dan Gerber
Managing Director
Advantage Property Styling
